ygData.subject: Re: Stein - No more - Addendum
ygData.msgSnippet: My point is that the DIDN T have money to waste.  they sold other possessions, begged, borrowed, and stole to get the money for a stein to hold in their left
ygData.messageBody:
My point is that the DIDN'T have money to waste. they sold other
possessions, begged, borrowed, and stole to get the money for a stein
to hold in their left hand. This patch is going to change it to a
right hand item. Can you see how they might be upset?

--- mstokes <mstokes@...> wrote:
> From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
>
> HiFi Review wrote:
>
> > From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>
> >
> > The real complaint is that I know players who have
> spent 500p or more
> > on a sacrificial dagger for the melee hand and
> 2000p for the mug. now
> > they've wasted money they could have spent
> elsewhere. I have no
> > concern about the quest being made more difficult.
> they should do
> > that, indeed. Changing the nature of an object
> people have spent their
> > entire fortunes on is unfair and will lead to many
> outraged players.
>
> If any type of Mage has 2500pp to drop on two items,
> I don't think money is
> a major concern. How do you fight with a Stien
> anyway? Is it a new melee
> catagory? I can see the message now "Your skill in
> Bar Room Brawls has
> increased (36)"
